description:
Café “Kuronekotei” boasts an unusual roster of employees. A group of automata, or autonomous mechanical dolls, serve their patrons with a smile, but they weren’t always so suited to domestic life. Just a few years prior, automata served as weapons in the great war, fulfilling the bloody purpose for which they were created. Now that the war has ended, these machines with human hearts search for their place in an unfamiliar, peaceful world — and their search begins at the Kuronekotei café.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

Note: Prima Doll was streamed 5 days in advance of the TV broadcast on ABEMA beginning July 3, 2022. Regular broadcasting began on July 9, 2022.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Steampunk
tags.description: Prominently features technology and designs inspired by 19th-century industrial steam-powered machinery.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

node.description:
Key is a Japanese visual novel studio. It is known for making dramatic and plot-oriented visual novels. Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tensho_tw) | [Website](http://tenshohp.web.fc2.com/)

Representative director of [Bibury](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/). Often teams up with [Masayuki Nonaka](https://anilist.co/staff/116301/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okano_tohya)

Touya Okano is a Japanese scenario writer and producer, affiliated with [Visual Arts](https://anilist.co/studio/203/Visual-Arts). On 27th July 2023 he was announced to be the new director of Visual Arts, and transferred his share to Tencent, making Visual Arts a child company of Tencent

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okano_tohya)

Some of their most famous works include CLANNAD, planetarian, and Little Busters!, among others. Several of their visual novels have received anime adaptations, making them quite well-known even outside of the visual novel community.

They've also formed Key Sounds Label for their music tracks, and they produced an Internet radio show called Key Net Radio which is now defunct as of 2010. Key works under the publishing company Visual Arts, where it originally sprung out of.

__Doujin Circle:__ Nankano Koubou

[Website](http://nankano.shisyou.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/lalalalack) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/83739) | [Potofu](https://potofu.me/lalalalack) | [Misskey.io](https://misskey.io/@lalalalack) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/lalalalack.bsky.social) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lack_illustrator/) | [Threads](https://www.threads.net/@lack_illustrator) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@lackism) | [Booth.pm](https://lack.booth.pm/) | [Tumbler](https://lalalalack.tumblr.com/)

He got married to an unknown person on January 18, 2022.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iktd13_)

Na-Ga is a male Japanese artist who is employed as a graphic designer and illustrator for the company Key known for such famous visual novels as Kanon, Air, and Clannad among others. Prior to working for Key, he was employed by the visual novel company Pearl Soft. Na-Ga has been working for Key since the production of Air as one of the computer graphic artists, but was able to majorly contribute to character design in Key's sixth visual novel Little Busters! with Itaru Hinoue, along with the later released Little Busters! Ecstasy and Kud Wafter. For Key's ninth title Rewrite, Na-Ga contributed to the game's computer graphics.
[Blog](http://harablog55.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_harayui) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=517112) | [Tumblr](http://harablog55.tumblr.com/)

[Website](http://www.fuzichoco.com) | [Blog](http://fuzichoko.blog39.fc2.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fuzichoco) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/fuzichoco) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=27517)

Began her professional career as early as highschool. Has an uncommon sense of colour depth among modern Japanese illustrators. Her work already expanded outside illustration for anime, manga and novels. She draws for outdoor campaigns, museums, and even was featured in TV shows as well. 
She now resides in Tokyo, Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/morikuraen) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/177784)

Character designer of Virtual YouTuber [Kizuna AI](https://anilist.co/character/206833).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/if_224)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MaK_Ishiwata)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/if_224)
Affiliated with [Bibury Animation Studios](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/Bibury-Animation-Studios).
Founder of Studio Homare.
Affiliated with [Bibury Animation Studios](https://anilist.co/studio/6180/Bibury-Animation-Studios).
[Twitter](https://x.com/ton_tsutchy)
Affiliated with Folium.

__Hobbies:__ Games, eating, tennis, swimming

[Website](https://columbia.jp/wakiazumi) | [Talent Page](https://haikyo.co.jp/profile/profile.php?ActorID=12722) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/azumi_waki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ajujustaff) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/azumi_waki)

On August 10, 2023, she announced on Twitter her marriage to her longtime partner met through a shared hobby of gaming.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
~!
• Charlotte (Genshin Impact)
 • Mem (Honkai: Star rail)!~

**Height:** 155 cm (5'1")

**[Website](https://www.kusunokitomori.com/) | [Profile (SMA)](https://www.sma.co.jp/s/sma/artist/441?ima=0000#/news/0) | [Profile (SMA VOICE)](http://smavoice.jp/s/sma03/artist/45?ima=5736) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomori_kusunoki)**

A Japanese voice actress who is currently affiliated with the Sony Music Artists agency. She made her voice acting debut in 2017, and in the same year she was cast in her first main role as Kirara, the heroine of the Japanese mobile game _Kirara Fantasia_. 

In September 2022, [Tomori announced her diagnosis with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome (EDS) affecting her joints](https://www.kusunokitomori.com/info/archive/?id=546582), which limits her ability to engage in physically demanding activities such as dancing. [It was announced on Love Live!’s website at the same time](https://www.lovelive-anime.jp/news/01_1248.html) that she would be graduating from the role of [Setsuna Yuuki](https://anilist.co/character/132796/Yuki-Setsuna) in March 2023, with [Coco Hayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/124857) replacing her in the role.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- [Vice](https://anilist.co/character/277198) - Alchemy Stars (VG)
- [Kanade Yoisaki](https://anilist.co/character/249636) - Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku (VG)
- Viper - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [Seattle](https://anilist.co/character/197197), [I-58](https://anilist.co/character/228624), Glasgow - Azur Lane (VG)
- [Aunn Komano](https://anilist.co/character/145527) - Touhou Cannonball (VG)
- Vanessa - Cytus II (VG)
- [Ruka Kayamori](https://anilist.co/character/321897) - Heaven Burns Red (VG)
- [Firefly](https://anilist.co/character/349493) - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yuki_Nakashim) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nakashima_yuki.official/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/nakashima_yuki/) | [Agency Profile](https://www.beffect.co.jp/talent/yuki/)

A voice actor and the current bassist in the band [Roselia](https://anilist.co/staff/153170/Roselia) as Lisa Imai.

Yuki was born in Wakayama Prefecture and lives in Tokyo. Until middle school she was a junior model for the magazines JS Girls and Sugar Princess Room. She also appeared in different commercials and dramas when she was a child.

She wanted to become a voice actress after seeing Gintama before she entered high school. Yuki was awarded the grand prize together with Takao Kanon in the National Seiyuu Grand Prix held by the seiyuu unit Earth Star Dream in 2014, and as a result she became a member of the unit. She then debuted as a voice actress with the role of Kinako Tanaka in the Teekyuu franchise, as well as starred in the series' stage adaptation.

Yuki was a member of Earth Star Dream until graduating in December 2017, and not long after her graduation the unit got suspended as well. On May 13, 2018, Yuki was then announced as Endou Yurika's replacement as Roselia's bassist and Lisa Imai's voice actor due to Yurika's retirement from the entertainment industry.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

[Profile](http://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/tomita_miyu/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miyu-tomita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyju_tomita) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomita__miyu._/)

The Grand Prix winner of the 2014 Seiyuu Artist Training Program Selection competition, which was sponsored by Amuse and Ken Production. After being scouted by six talent agencies, she eventually joined Amuse.

She made her voice acting debut in 2015, voicing a number of unnamed characters in Himouto Umaru-chan.

Non-Anime Roles
• Layla - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Zara - Memento Mori (VG)
• New Jersey - Azur Lane (VG)
• Jiu Niangzi - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
